clinical_study.brief_title: Tracheal Intubation With the Rigid Tube for Laryngoscopy- a New Method
clinical_study.official_title: A Comparative Study Between the Rigid Tube for Laryngoscopy, as a New Tool for Tracheal Intubation, and McCoy Laryngoscope in Difficult Airway Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: Iuliu Hatieganu University of Medicine and Pharmacy

clinical_study.source: Iuliu Hatieganu University of Medicine and Pharmacy

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the efficiency of the rigid tube for laryngoscopy for tracheal intubation in patients with presumed difficult airway and compare the classical laryngoscopy and this method in matter of glottis visualisation and tracheal intubation.

detailed_description.textblock:
The rigid tube for laryngoscopy is a 15 to 30 cm long metallic tube with a bevel end and a diameter of 0.5-2.0 cm , an instrument used to inspect the larynx and surrounding areas. It resembles a rigid bronchoscope but it is shorter. When in use, it has to be attached to a light source.
The hypothesis of the study stands that the rigid tube for laryngoscopy it could be more efficient in tracheal intubation for difficult airway patients than classical intubation with a curved blade laryngoscope.
The retromolar approach in both sides together with bujie intubation is the technique of intubation used in this study.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A group of patients with difficult airway criteria will be intubated using the rigid tube for laryngoscopy. A classical laryngoscopy with a Mc Coy laryngoscope will be performed prior intubation and the Cormack-Lehane grade of glottis visualisation will be noted.

primary_outcome.description: the time from starting to use the rigid tube for laryngoscopy until the airway was secured.

secondary_outcome.measure: complications during intubation with rigid tube
secondary_outcome.description: complications noticed during the use of rigid tube - oxygen desaturation of haemoglobin, cardiac rhythm disturbances, hypertension. bleeding, broken teeth

secondary_outcome.measure: late complications of intubation with rigid tube
secondary_outcome.description: complications noticed following the use of rigid tube - sore throat, airway injuries, neurological deficits.

arm_group.description: Tracheal intubation with the rigid tube for laryngoscopy for patients with difficult airway. Prior the use of rigid tube for laryngoscopy, a classical laryngoscopy with a Mc Coy laryngoscope will be performed.

intervention.description: the laryngoscopy with the Mc Coy laryngoscope performed prior the use of rigid tube and the Cormack-Lehane glottis visualisation noted.
intervention.other_name: laryngoscopy with Mc Coy curved blade laryngoscope

intervention.description: the view of glottis achieved with the rigid tub for laryngoscopy and tracheal intubation with an elastic gum bougie performed

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with criteria of anatomically difficult airway from Benomuf's eleven parameters analysis
- patients with airway pathology which predicted difficult intubation: tumours or cervical masses, previous radiotherapy or surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- stridor or marked laryngeal or tracheal stenosis, vocal cords polyps
- emergency surgery, decompensated cardiac or pulmonary disease
- grade 1 at classical laryngoscopy after Cormack- Lehane Classification
